article.headline: Colorado State 91, Pepperdine 65
article.story: DENVER (AP) -- Matt Nelson had 23 points and seven rebounds to lead Colorado State to its fourth straight victory, beating Pepperdine 91-65 Saturday at the Pepsi Center. Nelson was 9-for-16 shooting and 5-of-6 from the free throw. Jon Rakiecki had six 3-pointers and 18 points for Colorado State (8-4). Glen McGowan was 16-for-18 on free throws and had 20 points for Pepperdine. Terrance Johnson had 13 points, all in the second half for the Wave, which shot only 26 percent in the first half. Nelson scored six points in the first four minutes of the second half to lead 55-24. Pepperdine closed the gap with 8:13 remaining to 65-50. Rakiecki sank four 3-pointers on four shots in the last 5:28 for Colorado State. Nelson had five points and two blocks as part of a 15-0 run midway in the first half as Colorado State built a 25-5 lead. The Rams led by as much as 44-18. Pepperdine stayed cold and trailed 44-22 at the break.
